subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Finally a reply
msgSnippet: ... Van: Michael Fitzgerald  Aan: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com  Datum: woensdag 7 augustus 2002 10:28
messageBody:
-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
Van: Michael Fitzgerald <mchlf@...>
Aan: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Datum: woensdag 7 augustus 2002 10:28
Onderwerp: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Finally a reply

I keep a journal - a few entries a week - in QS, just to keep my hand in. I also use it in interviews or when I'm assessing people in work, face="jerome">abrapt or face="jerome">snoti don't look so bad in Read. I've never worried too much about dictionary spellings, and I quite enjoy hearing my own voice in the writing - obviously I'd try and modify this if I was writing for an audience, but that aint likely yet. The Read Alphabet introductory book has a lot of useful words and, spread thoughout it, are good examples of a 'standard' way to spell common sound combinations which might be the basis of a dictionary (has anyone compiled these alphabetically?). Personally, I can live without the agonising over gradations of sound in regional accents which the Shavian list seem to enjoy. I enjoy writing by hand rather than typing because I haven't had time to really get stuck into itthe typing convention. (I still haven't worked out where all the half letters are in Jerome and have to keep 'character map' open.) cheers, face="jerome">.mFk

You might want to take a loot at my Quikscript Typing Software:

http://quikscript.teraiten.cjb.net/

Download automatic.zip (it's somewhere on the bottom of the page). There is no documentation yet.

How exactly you can get this to work is described on the website, and in previous discusions in this forum. You type in NewRomaji, a romanised reform scheme, and on your screen appears proper Quikscript text. While you are typing, characters which have half-letter variants should automatically change where possible. It may be a bit buggy at the moment, but feel free to alter the program, for the source is open.

Ewout Stam (/EvQt stym)
